overview: Dedicated to the 25th anniversary of the signing of the Budapest Memorandum, where the signatory countries guaranteed Ukraine the preservation of territorial integrity in exchange for the renunciation of nuclear weapons. In 2014, when the annexation of Crimea by Russia took place, the signatory countries accepted the occupation. On December 5, 2019, our creative team carried out an intervention at the Museum of Modern Art in Odesa, in the form of an illegal installation of the "I Want More" exhibit in the museum's exposition. The purpose of the film and the intervention is to show the people of Ukraine and the international community that attempts to appease Russia and make concessions to it will only lead to new aggression and new occupation of territories.
title: Crime Without Punishment
